item.title: Perry2019
item.description: abstract = “In the current study, we compared emotion regulation abilities between post‐institu‐tionalized (PI; N = 124) and never‐institutionalized non‐adopted (NA; N = 172) chil‐dren and adolescents (7–15 years). We assessed cortisol reactivity and coded emotion regulation during the speech portion of Trier Social Stress Test (TSST‐M). Parents reported on their children’s social, academic, and behavioral adjustment. Results suggest that emotion regulation abilities increased with age, but this increase was greater for NA than PI youth.
